questions.question: What is the first step in finding the eigenvalues of a 2x2 matrix A?
options: Solving the characteristic equation det(A - λI) = 0
Finding the inverse of the matrix A
Calculating the trace of the matrix
Multiplying the matrix by a vector
questions.answer: Solving the characteristic equation det(A - λI) = 0

questions.question: A square matrix A is invertible if and only if:
options: Its determinant is zero
Its determinant is non-zero
It is a symmetric matrix
All its eigenvalues are positive

questions.question: In Euler's method for solving an ODE, what does the step size 'h' represent?
options: The accuracy of the initial condition
The increment in the independent variable (e.g., x) for each iteration
The value of the dependent variable y
The learning rate of the algorithm
questions.answer: The increment in the independent variable (e.g., x) for each iteration

questions.question: A discrete random variable X that represents the number of trials until the first success follows which distribution?
options: Binomial Distribution
Poisson Distribution
Geometric Distribution
Normal Distribution

questions.question: In a Markov chain, what does the term 'irreducibility' mean?
options: The chain has no cycles
The chain will eventually reach a steady state
It is possible to go from any state to any other state
All states have a period of 1
questions.answer: It is possible to go from any state to any other state

questions.question: What is the primary role of the learning rate in the gradient descent algorithm?
options: To determine the initial guess
To calculate the gradient of the function
To control the size of the steps taken towards the minimum
To decide when the algorithm has converged
questions.answer: To control the size of the steps taken towards the minimum

questions.question: What is a potential issue if the learning rate in gradient descent is set too large?
options: The algorithm will converge very slowly
The algorithm may overshoot the minimum and fail to converge
The algorithm will find the global minimum instead of a local one
The gradient calculation becomes more accurate
questions.answer: The algorithm may overshoot the minimum and fail to converge

questions.question: The Newton-Raphson method is an iterative procedure used for finding:
options: Eigenvalues of a matrix
The steady-state of a Markov chain
The minimum of a function
Approximate roots of a real-valued function
questions.answer: Approximate roots of a real-valued function

questions.question: In a discrete-time Markov chain, what must be true for all rows in the transition matrix P?
options: The sum of the elements in each row must be 1
The sum of the elements in each column must be 1
All elements must be greater than 1
The diagonal elements must be zero
questions.answer: The sum of the elements in each row must be 1

questions.question: Using Euler's method for the ODE dy/dx = 4x + 3y with y(0) = 0 and h = 0.01, what is the value of y1?
